locutie.beschrijving: The transition from 'slave' (doulos) to 'friend' in the relationship between Jesus and his disciples, framed within the context of a pastoral anniversary and the history of African American struggle.
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: Strong historical-philological focus on 'doulos' vs. 'slave', though the immediate Johannine context is secondary to the social-historical application.

illocutie.beschrijving: The preacher moves from honoring the pastor (Expressive) to explaining the text (Assertive) to declaring a new identity for the congregation (Declarative/Commissive).
voorbeelden: I call you not servants
I make a prophecy... you are going to go on to a future
I want to talk to you a little while today about 'A New Title'

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: To instill a sense of dignity, hope, and future-oriented confidence in a marginalized or developing community.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Implicit; the Spirit is the implied agent of the 'prophecy' and the 'victory' of God.

voorbeelden: The New Testament churches were all in the beginning what you are now.
Jesus did not give people titles downward.
A slave is somebody who works and never gets paid.
See to it in the future that you do not face this kind of venom... vote!
Listen to this word.
Remember that we have come from a breed of people...
I'm delighted to be here.
I thank God for the protests.
I am proud, too.
I make a prophecy... you are going to go on to a future.
God has in store for you great things.
We have a promise... we'll understand it better.
commissieven.kwaliteit: High. The preacher uses his apostolic-like authority to bind God's future to the congregation's present.

voorbeelden: I call you friend.
God bless you and God strengthen you.
I make a prophecy.
declaratieven.autoriteit: The preacher acts as a 'mandataris' (representative) of Christ's own speech act in John 15.

indicatoren: Extensive storytelling about the Studebaker car
Lengthy descriptions of New York politics
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer is educated and entertained but may wait a long time for the 'event' of the Word to strike them personally.

missende_elementen: Immediate sacramental address ('Today, this is fulfilled in your hearing')
performatief_deficit_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: A sense of 'God will do it' rather than 'God is doing it now'.

voorbeelden: God has in store for you great things.
The Lord will open before you a future that you cannot begin to see now.

eerste_persoon.gebruik: Used for personal anecdotes and establishing ethos.

tweede_persoon.gebruik: Directly addressing the church and Pastor Taylor.
tweede_persoon.performatieve_context: Used in the prophetic sections ('You are going to go on').

derde_persoon.distantie_effect: Creates a narrative distance that requires a 'bridge' to the present.

tijdloos_present.gebruik: General truths about God and friendship.

sacramenteel_patroon.beschrijving: The sermon moves from the Assertive (what a slave is) to the Declarative (I call you friend) to the Commissive (God will open a future).
voorbeelden: Jesus said... I call you friends... I make a prophecy... you are going to go on.
sacramenteel_patroon.kwaliteit: The transition from the 'indicative' of the text to the 'prophetic' of the situation is seamless.

voorbeelden_goede_verhouding: You are their heirs (Indicative). How sad it would be... to fail (Imperative).

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: Despite the high word count of anecdotes (constative), the sermon functions as a 'prophetic event' because the preacher assumes the authority to declare a new status over the congregation.

sterke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: I make a prophecy... you are going to go on to a future.
sterke_punten.effect: Creates a sense of divine destiny.

zwakke_punten.probleem: Takes up significant space before reaching the illocutionary core.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: The sermon 'happens' when the preacher shifts from talking about the text to speaking for God regarding the church's future.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: The 'Toezegging' (Promise) is the engine of the sermon.

openbaringsleer.god_als_spreker: Yes, through the 'prophecy' of the preacher.
openbaringsleer.prediker_als_mandataris: Highly evident in the use of 'I prophesy'.
tekstueel_bewijs: God has in store for you great things.

pneumatologie.geest_rol_erkend: Implicitly in the 'vision' and 'strength' given to the pastor.
pneumatologie.perlocutie_theologie: The preacher leaves the 'understanding' to the 'morning' (eschatological perlocution).
tekstueel_bewijs: We'll understand it better when the morning comes.

sacramentstheologie.preek_als_genademiddel: Yes, the sermon confers the 'New Title' it describes.
sacramentstheologie.epifanisch_taalgebruik: The use of 'I saw' (Revelation imagery) creates an epiphanic moment.

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is heavy on past-tense narrative verbs. Increasing present-tense performatives would sharpen the 'event' character.

specifieke_suggesties.huidige_formulering: Jesus says, I do not call you any longer slaves.
specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: Today, Jesus says to you, New Horizon: 'I do not call you slaves!'
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Moves from reporting a past speech act to mediating a present one.

toezegging_versterking.suggestie: The toezegging is already the strongest part.
voorbeeldzinnen: I declare to you that your past does not define your future.

adressering_verbetering.probleem: Too much 'we' and 'they' in the middle section.
adressering_verbetering.suggestie: Use 'You' more frequently when applying the 'friend' status.
voorbeeldzinnen: You are the friend of the Savior.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in prophetic preaching that uses narrative to build a foundation for a powerful, performative conclusion.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: SvT would focus on the preacher's 'self-revelation' (Studebaker story); SAT focuses on the 'Declarative' power of the 'New Title' given by God.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: Rhetoric would praise the metaphors; SAT focuses on the fact that the preacher actually *performs* the act of naming the congregation as 'friends'.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT reveals that the sermon's power isn't in the car story, but in the 'Commissives' where the preacher binds God's promise to this specific local church.

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: I make a prophecy... you are going to go on to a future.

appendices.notities: The sermon balances heavy narrative (Constative) with sharp prophetic bursts (Performative).
